subject: Photography
title: The Power of Juxtaposition
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Juxtaposition.

hook.text: A child's toy next to a soldier's boot. A flower growing through concrete. Juxtaposition creates meaning.

buildup.text: Juxtaposition places contrasting elements side by side, forcing the viewer to find connections and meaning.

discovery.text: The contrast can be visual (big/small), emotional (joy/sorrow), or conceptual (nature/industry).

twist.text: Neither element alone carries the message. The meaning lives in the space between them â€” in the relationship.

climax.text: Juxtaposition turns a photographer into a visual essayist â€” placing ideas in dialogue through image placement.

punchline.text: Put two things together. The viewer creates the third: meaning.

quiz.question: Where does meaning exist in juxtaposition?
options: In the relationship between the contrasting elements, not in either alone
In the background of the image
